Subjective: Fatigue for ~2 months; constant, wakes up tired. Onset unclear. Associated with increased muscle pain, back pain, and morning stiffness. Sleep possibly more superficial. Work is difficult but no sick days taken; exhausted post-shift. Exercise capacity preserved (climbing 2-3x/week, cycling). No specific joint pain, no chest pain, no palpitations, no shortness of breath. Appetite good, weight stable (72kg). Bowels/urination normal. Hay fever controlled with meds. No snoring. Concern: Worried about an underlying cause, specifically rheumatism.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm. General: No acute distress. Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally. Heart: Regular rate and rhythm. Abdomen: Soft, supple, non-tender to deep palpation. Lively peristalsis. MSK: Tenderness on palpation of lower back, paravertebral. No pain on pelvic compression. Neck and shoulders have full range of motion without pain.
Assessment: Fatigue, unspecified. Differential diagnosis includes anemia, hypothyroidism, and inflammatory/rheumatologic conditions. Cardiopulmonary etiology less likely given preserved exercise tolerance and normal exam.
Plan: 1. Lab work: Order blood tests for CBC (anemia), TSH (thyroid), and inflammatory markers. 2. Patient to schedule lab appointment via online portal. 3. Follow-up: Patient to call clinic the day after results are available to schedule a phone appointment for review.
